article.author: McSlaggart
article.title: Nicola Sturgeon’s edict to eschew the Union flag in favour of the blue and golden stars
article.text:
McSlaggart said:
The decision to fly the European flag from Scottish government buildings is an example of the country’s “crumbling” loyalty to the UK, Germany’s largest press agency has claimed. Deutsche Presse-Agentur (DPA) filed a dispatch on Nicola Sturgeon’s edict to eschew the Union flag in favour of the blue and golden stars. “Scotland no longer belongs to the EU since Brexit but the country does not want to accept that,” reported the Hamburg-based agency. “Now the Scottish government has taken down the flag of the UK, but the EU flag flies.”

www.thetimes.co.uk
This is a clever move as what does Boris do about it? I do not think Westminster would be wise to fight Nicola on this.

A clever move? Aren't you usually against people who spend their time trying to make points via the use of flags? That was your position when it came to Northern Ireland's loyalist fleggers. IIRC the position of Irish nationalists was that the loyalist fleggers were ignoring current reality, and were yearning for something unrealistic. Aren't the Scots Nats in exactly the same position?
